sentences.en: a scheduling clash on TV
sentences.cn: 电视节目时间安排上的冲突

sentences.en: Australia's rugby union team for the return clash with New Zealand is weakened by injury.
sentences.cn: 将再次和新西兰队交手的澳大利亚业余英式橄榄球队由于球员受伤实力削弱了.

sentences.en: Don't make any policy decisions which clash with official company thinking.
sentences.cn: 所作的任何决策都不要和公司官方理念相冲突。

sentences.en: Lewis has recently recovered his fitness and will clash with Christie in the 4x100m relay.
sentences.cn: 刘易斯近来恢复了状态，将在4×100米接力赛中和克里斯蒂一决雌雄。

sentences.en: My opinions clash against hers.
sentences.cn: 我和她意见不合.

sentences.en: personality/culture clash (=a situation in which two people or groups do not like each other)
sentences.cn: 个性/文化冲突

sentences.en: The clash of our onslaught hurtled across the field.
sentences.cn: 我们猛攻的声音传遍战场.

sentences.en: the clash of swords
sentences.cn: 剑的撞击声

sentences.en: The colour of the curtains has a clash with the colour of the wall.
sentences.cn: 窗帘的颜色与墙的颜色不协调.

sentences.en: The heavyweight clash goes ahead in Las Vegas on 8 May.
sentences.cn: 这次重量级拳击对战将于 5 月 8 日在拉斯维加斯举行。

sentences.en: The incident triggered an armed clash.
sentences.cn: 这起事件触发了一场武装冲突.

sentences.en: The only victors in a head-on clash between the president and the assembly would be the hardliners on both sides.
sentences.cn: 总统和议会之间正面冲突的唯一赢家将是双方的强硬派。

sentences.en: The orange curtains clash against the red furniture.
sentences.cn: 橘色窗帘和红色家具不协调.

sentences.en: The pot came down on the stone floor with a clash.
sentences.cn: 锅“当”地一声掉到石地上.

sentences.en: The stringed instruments clash.
sentences.cn: 琴瑟不调.

sentences.en: The two sides will clash there only if Chelsea beat Sunderland in their quarter-final replay.
sentences.cn: 只有切尔西队在四分之一决赛的重赛中击败桑德兰队，双方才会交锋。

sentences.en: There is a clash between two classes at 2 p.m. on Thursday.
sentences.cn: 星期四下午两点有两堂课是冲突的.

sentences.en: Tonight's clash between Real Madrid and Arsenal is being heralded as the match of the season.
sentences.cn: 今晚皇家马德里队和阿森纳队之间的对决被称为本赛季最重要的比赛。

sentences.en: Troops clashed near the border.
sentences.cn: 军队在边境附近发生了冲突。

sentences.en: When two industrial giants clash, small companies can get caught in the crossfire.
sentences.cn: 两大工业企业争斗之下, 小公司遭受池鱼之殃.

words.tran_cn: 冲突，不协调；碰撞声，铿锵声

trans.tran_cn: 冲突，分歧，争论，不协调，撞击声，交锋
trans.tran_en: a short fight between two armies or groups – used in news reports

trans.tran_cn: 发生冲突，不相容，不协调，交锋，发出撞击声
trans.tran_en: if two armies, groups etc clash, they start fighting – used in news reports

trans.tran_cn: 发生冲突； 不协调； 撞击声
trans.tran_en: if two armies, groups etc clash, they start fighting – used in news reports

trans.tran_cn: 发生冲突；不协调；砰地相撞，发出刺耳的撞击声
trans.tran_en: if two armies, groups etc clash, they start fighting – used in news reports
